List.Title: The political structure of the world

Item.Caption: During the meeting, the UN Security Council
Istanbul - formerly the capital of the mighty Ottoman Empire
At the peak of its power (2 floors. XIX century.) British Empire covered an area of 33,000,000 square meters. km with a population of 370 million people
New York is sometimes called the capital of the world
Houses of Parliament. Belfast, Northern Ireland
Queen Elizabeth II - the head of the British Commonwealth of Nations
U.S. flag with stars and stripes - a symbol of the federal structure of the country: 50 stars represent the states of the state
Blue Helmets - the formation of the UN on peacekeeping and humanitarian missions in many parts of the world
Traditionally neutral Switzerland has only recently become a member of the UN
The traditional way of life persists in many parts of Eastern Europe
